718244f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake and the boat house.
718244f-a.text:
Central Park: The Boat House and the Lake.
May 1892.
Ewing Galloway.
Neg # 4746
718244f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake and the boat house., Manhattan, NY

718253f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718253f-a.text:
Central Park: The Lake, eastern bay, a view south towards the Bethesda Fountain and the Esplanade at the northern end of the Mall.
1892.
Ewing Galloway.
718253f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718254f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718254f-a.text:
Central Park: Lake, eastern bay, showing the Bethesda Fountain and the Terrace at the northern end of the Mall. At the head of the steps is the 72nd Street cross drive.

May, 1892

Ewing Galloway
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718254f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718238f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718238f-a.text:
Central Park: The Lake, view north, showing the Bow Bridge which spans the neck between the eastern bay and the main body of the Lake.
1892.
Ewing Galloway.
718238f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718248f.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake ; Bow Bridge.
718248f.text:
Central Park: Bow Bridge which spans a neck of the Lake.
About 1895.
718248f.folder: Central Park & The Lake ; Bow Bridge., Manhattan, NY

718240f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake
718240f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view towards Central Park West at 72nd Street and south, showing wild ducks and geese. The bridge spans a narrow part of the Lake in the center of it.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view west across the southwestern bay of the Lake, showing some of the wild geese on the shore in the foreground. The old Majestic Hotel and part of the Dakota apartment house
are shown in the right foreground.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
718240f-b.folder: Central Park & The Lake, Manhattan, NY

718243f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718243f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, along the northern shore, near the Ramble. The woman in the foreground is feeding the wild geese.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another part of the northern shore, near the Ramble, showing
some 1ittle boys fishing.
Summer, 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
718243f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718241f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake
718241f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: the Lake showing the western shore and Central Park West from 74th to 76th Streets. The apartment houses shown are the Langham, the old San Remo, and the Kenilworth. The Church of the Divine Paternity (Universalist) stands on the S.W. corner of 76th Street.
In the foreground some wild geese are swimming.
1923.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, ten years later, showing the new San Remo standing on the site of the old one.
The Goodyear blimp is flying overhead.
May 17, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2.
May 17, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.
718241f-b.folder: Central Park & The Lake, Manhattan, NY

718252f-c.text:

718237f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view west of south towards Sixth
Avenue and 59th Street, showing boating parties out on the
water.
Summer, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
Summer, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The saae, at a later date. Note the 70-storied E.G.A. Building  iw the center.
June 24, 1935.
6ke4E5hoe.

718231f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718231f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view southeast towards 60th Street. The two apparently tallest buildings, in the center, are the new Hotel Pierre at 6lst Street and the new Hotel Sherry-Netherland
at 59th Street and Fifth Avenue.
July 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view four years later, roughly covering the left two-thirds of No. 1. Notice the reflcction of the H'otel Pierre and the
other buildings.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
718231f-b.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718231f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718231f-a.text:

718246f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718246f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view south, from the northeastern shore.
July 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Two years later, a view nearly the same but including a few buildings on Sixth Avenue and west not shown in the first view. The new R. C. A. Building at Radio City, had it been built at the time, would have been almost entire off the picture at
the right.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A similar view to No. 1, from the eastern side of the little
promontory in the foreground.
Notice the Goodyear dirigible overhead.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
718246f-c.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718256f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718256f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view southeast towards the hotels at
the Plaza, Fifth Avenue and 59th Street.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, two years later; the camera points more towards
west than in either (1) or (3).
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as the first view, four years later, but taken from closer to the southeastern shore, on a sunny afternoon.
June 24, 1935.
L. Sperr.

718247f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park : The Lake, southwestern bay, view west towards 72nd Street. The old Dakota apartment house is the building at the
right.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.  ,- ,r
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  N E G R112:
(2)
The same, at a small footbridge, also showing the Langham on
Central Park West from 73rd to 74th Streets.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A close view of the western shore at 74th Street, with the Langham apartment house in the background. Notice the 1ittle
boy with his sailboat.
May 17, 1933.

718229f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718229f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park : The Lake, view nearly due south, showing five ducks swimming in the foreground, and the midtown skyscrapers on the horison. The Hotel Plaza, with the Chrysler Building behind it, is a little to the left of center.
May 17, 1933.
P. 1  .. Sperr.
(2)
The same, anothor view. Notice how the Empire State Building at Fifth Avenue is hidden by the building between Essex House and the R. C. A. Building at Radio City. A little to the left of these, just in the center, a dirigible balloon is seen against
tho sky, probably the Goodyear blimp.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Spern.
(3)
The same, two years later. Another contrast is provided by the fact that this third picture is an afternoon view, possibly as late as four, which explains the blackness of the shadows
along the shore to thc right.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
718229f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718245f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a rowboat landing platform on the northwestern shore. The view is south.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Northern part, a view south from above 'Indian Cave'.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, two years later, taken from the rock in the right foreground of the 1933 view.
June 24, 1935.
L. Sperr.

718234f-a.text:

June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

718232f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

roughly north.
June 24, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

718249f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
718249f-a.text:
Central Park. Youthful skippers return to their favorite sport again. The lake in Central Park, New York, where the youngsters are enjoying themselves this bright
spring weather.
Pictorial Press Photos, 145 W. 41st St., N.Y.C.
', e2NO
718249f-a.folder: Central Park & The Lake., Manhattan, NY

718255f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
